data.title: Ok Pizza
data.text: Reasonable service and reasonable pizza. Selection and quality of toppings could have been better. Lots of parking.

data.title: Friendly Staff
data.text: Perfect place to grab a slice of pizza with wonderful friendly staff. The price is right, the food is delicious, and there is seating if you so desire.

data.title: Quick and easy
data.text: Piece of pizza or a whole pie - pick your poison! As you step up to order, there are usually several ready made slices to chose from just waiting to be warmed up for you! Prices are very reasonable, under $5 per slice. Can't say it's my favorite but its ok in terms of eat ability. Crust is bland.

data.title: Good pizza, just a tad slow
data.text:
We were looking for a kid-friendly meal for dinner and this was a good fit.  Overall, a good experience as we were not in a hurry.  Food was very good, but this place focusses first on "slices", then on their own take out/delivery, and finally the eat in customer.  

We waited about 45 mins for our two medium pizzas - which was fine.

I would say they could have used some floor service to tidy up the 12 or so tables/booths after customers would leave as they tables were a bit sticky and messy.

This is really an enhanced self-serve cafeteria style.

data.title: Good Gluten Free pizza
data.text: It's great that I can get a good gluten free pizza nearby. I like their arugula salad also. Quick service to stay or take out.

data.title: Great place
data.text: The pizza was excellent. For me it didn't seem that it worth to buy a whole pizza,but one slice is a good deal. The pesto one is excellent.

data.title: Most friendly staff ever!
data.text: What a great team at this branch of Pizza my heart - they were friendly fast and just the best customer service I've ever had at a fast food quick place ever - really loved it and the pizza was amazing ! Thank you.

data.title: Pizza By The Slice
data.text:
I ordered a slice of the Pesto Cheese Pizza and my companion had a combination meat slice with garlic.  We purchased the slices ready made from the counter; the server put them in the oven for a few minutes to heat them up.  The total bill was $8.50 for two.  The slices filled two small eaters up.  If you are a big eater, you will need two slices.  If you are a very big eater, order one slice at a time and see how many it takes.

The sensory experience of the pizza was very good.  The crust was very thin.  The slices were served hot.

You can order custom made pizza; it takes about 15 minutes. 

The servers were very pleasant and polite.  After one places an order, his name will be called to pick up the pizza at the counter. 

To eat the pizza, one can use his hands or use plastic utensils.  The utensils did not cut the pizza well, so we defaulted to using hands.

I addition to pizza, the restaurant serves salads and soft drinks; we did not try these items.

The restaurant has comfortable booths or one can eat at a table out in front.
The dining room was very clean.  The restrooms were clean and well stocked.

There was free parking out front.

Given the speed of service, one can be in and out in twenty minutes, depending how much and how fast one eats.

data.title: Great slices, good service, surfing history
data.text: This place is great and really speaks to some of surfing history of CA, particularly here in northern california.  The Pizza is great, crispy, cheesy, and topped with plenty of veggies and meats (i always get the combination slices).  Best of all? its quick and they heat up the slice right as you order!

data.title: Good Pizza and fair prices.
data.text: This is a very convenient place with fast service and excellent pizza. Lots of choice for toppings and large fresh salads. I often gab lunch there when I am short on time but want great tasting fresh food at a good price.

data.title: Lot's of choices, one slice at a time
data.text: Good quality thin crust. Sometimes a little greasy but wide selection. Surfing-themed decor. Pretty good prices. Fast service.

data.title: Best pizza in my opinion in Cupertino
data.text: I love Pizza my heart - and so is my family. Pesto pizza, chicken with garlic, all meats type etc etc are all good. I am not their pineapple fan. Seating is good, clean and gives a bit of coastal feeling. Staff is really god and helpful. Use their coupons they advertise locally - good value.

data.title: Love the consistency and service
data.text: I always enjoy their great product.  I can count on a great pizza everytime.  I really injoy the service and can count on them having my pizza ready when they say it will be!  Keep up the great work!

data.title: PIZZA PERFECTION
data.text:
Being an East Coaster, but having lived in CA for the past 30 years, I am a picky pizza person. Pizza My Heart has captured my heart, as well as that of our family & friends, & all our out of town guests.
The thin crust is perfect, the sauce is perfectly seasoned w many herbs, and the toppings are unique. My personal fav is served on Tuesdays, the Little Sur, covered w 40 cloves of roasted garlic, portobello  mushrooms, thin slices of red pepper, tiny slices of green onions
 ( scallions), and small cherry  tomatoes. All pizzas are reasonably priced, slices are a steal, & the salads are actually very good & fresh.
The best part is you can go in any time of day and get a slice of whatever they have out-usually at least 5-6 different kinds. Of course, you can also order any whole pizza in various sizes.
They have a creative choice of pizzas but the regular cheese pizza more than holds it own w any NYC pizzeria.
Try it. You'll like it...make that love it.

data.title: best pizza
data.text: hands down the best, this is my goto place for good quality and variety pizzas. By the slice or an entire pie, always great, fresh, hot and delicious!

data.title: The service is excellent and quick
data.text: We almost order the pizza from here once a week, and the service is excellent and quick, pizza always warm and tasty.

data.title: Best pizza in the world
data.text: Originally from Santa Cruz, whenever I travel to the US, I always stop for pizza at least once at Pizza My Heart. Their thin-crust pizza is one of the best in the world. And that's not just my opinion coming from their home town, they recently became the first American pizza to ever win the "Best Traditional Pizza" prize at the International Pizza Competition in Las Vegas. I prefer their Maui Wowie - Canadian bacon and pineapple.
